issue.title: [Bug] Version control: Edge rule chain id not substituted correctly
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to import rule chains and device profiles that have defaultEdgeRuleChainId, an error occurs:

could not execute statement; SQL [n/a]; constraint [fk_default_edge_rule_chain_device_profile]; nested exception is org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement

issue.title: [Question] Alarm count and categorization
issue.body: **Component** * Rule Engine **Description** I'm buinding a dashboard for an asset list (let's call it `Stores`). Stores can have `Energy Meter` and `HVAC` devices attached to it. I'd like to show a counter for each Store and Devices with the number of alarms, but they should be categorized as a `Energy` subsystem alarm or `HVAC` (in the example in portuguese, I call it `Climatização`. I can have other subsystems too, and depending on the device group it belongs, that should increment that specific counter. The alarms are also propagated to the parent asset (`Store`), that will have the sum of all other alarms counter, per category too For that, I created a rule chain that gets the alarm creation/clear/etc event and calls the counter node. The issue is that 1) I can't check to which device group the originator device belongs so I can't categorize it 2) As the alarm is also propagated to the parent Asset, the device group logic wouldn't apply to the Store, as it doesn't belong to a device group itself (it contains devices in different subsystems) This rule is now only counting events in the `Energy` subsystem. I know that I could filter alarms by type, but it's very high maintenance. Also, if I have an inactivity device alarm (`Disconnected` alarm created), would be the same as another device in another subsystem would fire too. I could prefix the event type with the subsystem but I also dislike this solution. Is there an easier way for doing that? **Environment** * ThingsBoard Cloud

issue.title: [Question] How to prevent markdown/html card from scrolling eg. size fixed to content
issue.body:
**Component**
 * UI

**Description**
I'm trying to include some text within a Markdown/HTML card widget that will always be fully displayed (the text should always be fully displayed), regardless of the zoom settings or resolution of the viewing device. I want to ensure that the text is easily readable and accessible for all users.

Do you have any suggestions for how I can achieve this? I would appreciate any advice or tips you have on creating a design that is both user-friendly and responsive to different devices and screen sizes.

Right now on some devices there will be shown a scroll bar on the side and I want to eliminate that.

**Environment**
<!-- Add information about your environment and ThingsBoard version if applicable -->

 * ThingsBoard: 3.3.2 CE

comment.body:
@ChristianPastenR 

It's a bit janky but works for me on Thingsboard PE 3.5.1.  Maybe in 3.6 there are some changes?  Not sure.

**Final result**
![image](https://github.com/thingsboard/thingsboard/assets/69659611/edfdec41-db64-4aba-a54e-1204eaefefdd)

1. Create Markdown/HTML Card and add html.
2. Use id="popup" in a tag
3. Create action on html element click
![image](https://github.com/thingsboard/thingsboard/assets/69659611/f1230be8-9b93-4290-9d72-c95b99797a43)
4. In popup state, create buttons as you like and use the layout option auto fill height.
![image](https://github.com/thingsboard/thingsboard/assets/69659611/4bfb2041-c4ba-4c4d-b18b-fe0af9ce2b84)
